module.p:
éisd ri eun listen to a bird –
Bha Calum sgìth a’ coiseachd air a’ mhonadh, ach mu dheireadh ràinig e mullach na beinne. [...] Bha latha briagha ann agus bha a’ ghrian a’ deàrrsadh. Cha robh neul anns an adhar. Bha an uiseag a’ seinn os cionn a chinn agus bha na h-eòin a’ ceileireadh am measg nan creag. ’S toigh le Calum a bhith ag éisdeachd ris na h-eòin.
Malcolm was tired walking on the moor, but at last he reached the top of the mountain. [...] It was a beautiful day and the sun was shining. There wasn’t a cloud in the sky. The lark was singing above his head and the birds were warbling among the rocks. Calum likes to listen to the birds. td. 146
